column3: AP - John Smoltz might rejoin the Braves' rotation if Atlanta finds another closer.

column2: Keeping Mad Cow Out of Cosmetics
column3: Since mad cow disease turned up in the United States late last year, traced to a cow imported from Canada, federal regulators have issued rules to prevent the spread of the fatal disease, focusing on limiting beef imports, testing and other measures to protect the domestic herd.

column2: Kmart Swings to Profit in 2Q; Stock Surges (AP)
column3: AP - Shares of Kmart Holding Corp. surged 17 percent Monday after the discount retailer reported a profit for the second quarter and said chairman and majority owner Edward Lampert is now free to invest the company's  #36;2.6 billion in surplus cash.

column2: Relations with India not at Pakistans expense: China
column3: BEIJING: Chinas improving relations with India will not come at the expense of Pakistan, Chinese Premier Wen Jiabao said in his meeting with Prime Minister Shaukat Aziz here on Wednesday.
